name: ALOHA DIP
subtitle: (Fruit)

ingredients.name: Any fruit such as pineapple, apples (sliced), grapes, strawberries, melon, peaches, pears or plums.

steps: Mix together sugar and sour cream. Fold in cookie pieces. Chill. Do not stir again or cookies will mush. Serve in 1/2 fresh pineapple shell. Place in center of large plate. Arrange fruit around pineapple.
by: Ruth Graham Cross, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BEER CHEESE
steps: Grate cheese; mix in beer and remaining items. Coarse texture is desired. Add paprika and parsley for color. Refrigerate overnight.

name: CHEESE BALL
steps: Mix and shape into ball and roll in crushed nuts. This can be frozen.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: CHEESE WAFERS
subtitle: (Dough Makes About 30 Wafers)

ingredients.name: flour (use dry measuring cup, scrape off excess)

steps: Before baking, beat 1 egg in a plate with 1/2 teaspoon water. One cup chopped walnuts with just enough flour goes in to hold the dough together. A firm cheese like Swiss may take only 3/4 cup. Start with a minimum amount of flour and add until mixture holds its shape well enough to form a ball. Always bake a small sample first to test before you form all mixture into rolls. Form dough into 2 rolls 1 1/2-inches in diameter. Turn them in, the beaten egg mixture, let dry a moment, then roll in chopped walnuts or sesame seed. Wrap and chill the rolls or freeze. Cut each into 15 slices and bake on buttered cookie sheet 12 to 15 minutes at 450°.

name: CLAM DIP

ingredients.name: small can clams, drained and minced
pkg. dry green onion dip mix (use 1/2 of 1 1/8 oz. package)

steps: Mix all ingredients and chill for 1 hour before serving.
by: Donna Graham Englert, Daughter of Tom and Pat Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: COCKTAIL MEATBALLS
steps: Mix first 6 ingredients well. Gently shape into small balls. Melt shortening in large skillet. Brown meatballs. Remove meatballs from skillet. Pour off fat. Heat chili sauce and grape jelly in skillet, stirring constantly, until jelly is melted. Add meatballs and stir until coated. Simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes. Makes about 5 dozen appetizers.

name: CRAB DIP

ingredients.name: 8 oz. pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese, softened

steps: Mix all the above together (except crabmeat and seafood sauce) until well blended. Spread over bottom of plate. Ice with Crosse and Blackwell seafood sauce. Thaw crab meat; drain thoroughly. Squeeze out excess moisture. Flake and spread over seafood sauce.
by: Pat Graham, Wife of Tom Graham, Son of George and Josie Graham

name: CRAZY MEATBALLS

ingredients.name: 14 oz. can Bavarian style sauerkraut, drained and rinsed
chili sauce bottle full of water

steps: Combine beef, crumbs, eggs and soup mix in bowl. Mix well. Shape into 1-inch balls. Place in 9 x 13-inch dish. Combine remaining ingredients in bowl; mix well. Pour over meatballs. Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.

name: DEVILED EGGS
steps: Cut eggs in halves lengthwise. Remove egg yolks and set aside. Mash yolks with fork, then blend in mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, salt, Worcestershire sauce and pepper. Refill whites using about 1 tablespoon of yolk mixture for each egg half.

Variations__ Add any of the following ingredients to yolk mixture: finely chopped parsley or chives, deviled ham or finely minced ham, minced onions, crumbled bacon, drained tiny shrimp or flaked tuna, pickle relish, finely chopped pitted black or green olives, radishes or celery (grated), Parmesan cheese, shredded Cheddar cheese, toasted sesame seed or finely chopped toasted almonds.

name: GREAT VEGETABLE DIP
steps: Blend. Makes almost a quart. Great with celery, green pepper, broccoli, cauliflower, carrots and green onion.
by: Debbie Cross Booker, Daughter of Ruth and Henry Cross, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: HAM BALL

ingredients.name: chipped ham (reserve some to roll ball in)

steps: Cream cheese with electric mixer; add green onion, Accent and Worcestershire sauce. Mix well. Add chipped ham and mix well. Chill for an hour in refrigerator, then form into a ball and roll in remaining ham.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Tammie Campbell Cross

name: HOT CHEESE DIP
steps: Cook sausage (do not brown, simmer slowly) and drain. Add to cheese and milk. Melt all together and add pimentos. Serve with chips and vegetables.

name: LAYERED MEXICAN DIP

ingredients.name: medium tomatoes, seeded and coarsely chopped

steps: Brown meat; drain excess fat. Stir in refried beans, chili and taco seasoning mix. Spoon evenly into large plate or platter. Spoon picante sauce over top. Spread sour cream over meat, leaving a narrow border. Sprinkle with lettuce, tomato and Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese. Serve with corn chips. Garnish with ripe olives.

name: MEXICAN ROLL-UPS
steps: Mix cream cheese with chopped chilies together. Add green onions and garlic salt. Spread on tortillas (1 heaping tablespoon). Roll jelly roll fashion. Slice each roll-up in 4 or 5 pieces. Place seam side down and chill 2 hours (can be frozen ahead). Serve with salsa or picante sauce.
by: Donna Graham Englert, Daughter of Tom and Pat Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PARTY BROCCOLI
steps: Cook broccoli until just tender-crisp; drain. Sauté onion in butter. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream, sugar, vinegar, poppy seed, paprika, salt and cayenne pepper. Arrange broccoli on platter. Pour sour cream sauce over top. Sprinkle with cashews.

name: PUMPKIN BLOSSOMS
subtitle: (Fried)
steps: Wash blossoms; drain and flatten. Mix together cracker crumbs, corn meal, flour, salt and pepper. Dip in egg beaten with a little milk. Roll in crumb mixture. Fry in large skillet with 1/4 to 1/2-inch hot oil. Brown one side, turn and brown the other side (these brown quickly, so work fast).
You may freeze pumpkin blossoms by folding in half and putting paper between each one. When you fry these, try to get them in the skillet before they thaw.

name: SHRIMP WON TON
steps: Mix all ingredients together and fill won ton skins with teaspoon of filling. Seal with egg and fry in hot oil. Serve with Sweet & Sour Sauce (see recipe), or Chinese Mustard.

name: SWEET & SOUR SAUCE
steps: Cook over medium heat until thick and clear.

name: SMOKED SALMON SPREAD

ingredients.name: 16 oz. can salmon, drained, bones removed and flaked

steps: In small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until light and fluffy (2 to 3 minutes). Add onion, salt, lemon juice, liquid smoke and horseradish. Continue beating until well mixed (1 to 2 minutes). Stir in salmon. Spoon into serving bowl. If desired, garnish with pecans and parsley. Serve with crackers. Makes about 2 cups.
by: Betty Lockard Wagner, Daughter of Belle and George Lockard, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SPECIAL CHEESE RING
steps: Combine all ingredients except preserves, season to taste with pepper. Mix well and place in a 5 or 6 cup lightly greased ring mold. Refrigerate until firm for several hours Or overnight. To serve, unmold, and, if desired, fill center with strawberry preserves or serve plain with crackers.

name: STUFFED MUSHROOMS
steps: Sauté mushrooms in butter, top sides down. Put on platter. Add onions to butter; saute. Add all ingredients but cheese. Stuff mushrooms; sprinkle with cheese. Broil 3 minutes.

name: SWEET AND SOUR MEATBALLS
steps: Combine hamburger, onion (chopped), salt and pepper Make into small balls. Brown in skillet. Mix sauce; combine all and simmer for 4 hours.

name: SWEET POTATO AND PECAN BALLS
steps: Combine potatoes, salt, butter, flavoring, sugar, eggs, pecans and coconut. Mold into balls around marshmallows and roll in corn flakes. Place in oiled baking dish. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes or until hot and slightly browned. Makes 16 servings.

name: TACO PIE
steps: Layer in deep pie dish. Spread bean dip evenly, like Pie crust. Peel avocados; remove seeds. Blend until smooth in blender with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Spread over bean dip. Mix sour cream, mayonnaise and taco seasoning. Spread evenly over avocado mix. Top with onion pieces. Alternate chopped tomatoes and lettuce. Top with shredded Cheddar cheese. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours. Dip your nacho chips, scoop up the pie.
by: Donna Graham Englert, Daughter of Tom and Pat Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: TACO PIE

ingredients.name: 8 oz. can refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
Velveeta Mexican pasteurized process cheese spread with jalapeño pepper, cubed

steps: Brown meat; drain. Stir in tomato sauce and seasoning mix; simmer 5 minutes. Press dough onto bottom and sides of ungreased 12-inch pizza pan, pressing edges together to seal. Prick bottom and sides with fork. Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cover with meat mixture. Top with process cheese spread. Continue baking until process cheese spread begins to melt. Top with remaining ingredients. Serve sour cream.

name: TEX MEX

ingredients.name: pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix
small can taco sauce (hot or mild)

steps: Mix together cottage cheese, cream cheese and dressing mix. Layer on top the green onions, lettuce (chopped), shredded cheese and tomatoes (chopped). Pour small can Laco sauce (hot or mild) over lop. Serve with corn chips.

name: TUNA DEVILS
steps: Cut eggs in half lengthwise. Remove yolks. Mash. Add tuna, mayonnaise, chili sauce, green pepper, onion, mustard and pepper sauce. Mix well. Divide mixture among egg whites, heaping high. Garnish with pimento and parsley.

name: VEGGIE BARS
steps: Spread rolls in 10 x 15-inch pan, seal all edges and holes. Bake at 400° for 10 minutes. Cool. Combine all other ingredients, except vegetables and cheese. Spread over baked rolls. Top with chopped vegetables. Sprinkle with cheese. Cut into 2-inch squares. Makes 30 squares.
Another Version-- , 16 oz. cream cheese, 1 envelope Ranch dressing mix, 1/2 c. mayonnaise

name: SWEET RELISH
steps: Mix all ingredients. Let set overnight, then place in jars and seal.

name: CUCUMBER PICKLES
steps: Put cucumbers into 1/2 gallon jar. Add all other ingredients and finish filling with water. Seal tight; set aside until ready to use, at least 3 to 4 weeks. When ready to use, drain, rinse, slice and put into jar. Add 2 to 2 1/2 cups sugar and 3 tablespoons water. Shake well and set in refrigerator. Shake often until syrup forms and covers pickles. So good!
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham (Given to Nora by Opal Altizer)

name: GREEN TOMATO PICKLES
steps: Put tomatoes, peppers, onions and spice in-large pan. Pour vinegar (cider) until about 2 inches from top of pickles. Add sugar until vinegar is sweet to taste. Bring to simmer (do not boil). Fill jars and seal. Let stand 2 weeks before using.

name: OLD FASHION CROCK PICKLES
steps: In a 4 gallon churn, place 2 cups of salt to a gallon of water over whole cucumbers. Let stand for 7 days. Rinse and slice. Put back in churn and add 2 to 3 ounces alum to 1 gallon of water. let set 2 days and nights. Drain; cover with apple cider vinegar and let set 2 days and nights. Drain. Pour cucumbers out. Clean the churn and then put 1 layer of cucumbers, 1 thick layer of sugar and 1 layer of pickling spices. Repeat layers until churn is full. Cover with plate or cover and let set.
This is a very old and very good recipe given to me by Mrs. C. W. Murphy who got it from her mother. They are to be left setting on the counter in the churn.

name: CHEESY BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients.name: Velveeta pasteurized process cheese spread, cubed
10 oz. pkg. broccoli, cooked and drained

steps: In 2 quart saucepan, cook onions in margarine until tender. Add remaining ingredients; stir over low heat until process cheese spread is melted and mixture is hot. Top each serving with toasted slivered almonds, if desired. Makes four 3/4 cup servings.

name: HODGEPODGE SOUP
steps: Brown ground beef. Add garlic, onion and celery and sauté. Add all other ingredients and simmer 30 minutes.
by: Lois Hollon, Daughter of Nora and Ova Hollon, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: POTATO SOUP
steps: Cook potatoes in a little water until just barely done; drain. Sauté onion and celery in butter until tender-crisp. Add to potatoes, then milk, salt and pepper. Heat, but do not boil.

name: SENATE BEAN SOUP
steps: Simmer beans 2 hours. At end of first hour add mashed potatoes. Stir in well. Then add onions, celery tops, parsley, salt and pepper. Let simmer second hour. Take ham bone from soup and remove meat from bone. Chop meat in slivers. Return to soup and reheat. Makes 8 servings.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BROCCOLI AND CAULIFLOWER SALAD
steps: Combine cauliflower, broccoli and onion; toss well. Combine remaining ingredients, mixing well. Pour over vegetables. Yields 6 to 8 servings.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: CAULIFLOWER SALAD

ingredients.name: pkg. (small) Hidden Valley salad dressing mix

steps: Mix milk and mayonnaise with salad dressing. Pour over vegetables and mix. Let set for an hour, then serve. This must be a great recipe!
by: Pat Graham, Nora Graham Hollon, Josie Elkins Hollon

name: CHICKEN SALAD

ingredients.name: chicken breasts (whole or 4 halves), cooked, skinned, boned and diced

steps: Combine first four ingredients in large bowl. Mix well. Stir in chicken and refrigerate until cold. Just before serving, stir in grapes, cashews, pepper and salt. Spoon onto lettuce lined platter or make sandwiches. White pepper is the secret for better flavor. Makes 6 servings.
by: Ella Potter Graham, Wife of James I. Graham, James: Son of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Fonzie: Son of George and Josie Graham

name: CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients.name: 20 oz. can crushed pineapple (drain and save juice)
sugar (use 1 c. if apples are sour)
hot water with juice of pineapple

steps: Make Jell-O and cool. Add juice to get 1 1/2 cups with water. Put pineapple, cranberries, apples and pecans through chopper. Mix all ingredients and chill until set.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: CRANBERRY SALAD
steps: Run cranberries and orange through food chopper, mix all ingredients and refrigerate.

name: ELSIE'S STRAWBERRY SALAD
steps: * Sometimes I add 1 package unflavored gelatin to make firmer.
Dissolve gelatin in water. Add remaining ingredients except sour cream. Let half stand until like jelly. Add layer of sour cream and remaining half of Jell-O mixture. Keep Jell-O in refrigerator.

name: FROZEN PEA SALAD
steps: Chop lettuce in bottom of pan. Sprinkle celery on top of lettuce, green peppers on celery, onion on green pepper and cheese on top of green pepper. Whip Miracle Whip and spread on top of all ingredients. Sprinkle peas on top of dressing. Sprinkle bacon over all. Chill overnight in sealed tight container. Mix before serving.

name: FRUIT SALAD
steps: Drain the pineapple juice, cut up bananas into this and let set and drain before adding to pudding. Drain fruit cocktail, add instant pudding and combine all fruit with this.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: FRUIT SALAD
steps: Drain fruit (not too dry) and toss all ingredients with 1 box Dream Whip or frozen Cool Whip (softened).

name: FRUITY CHICKEN SALAD
steps: Combine salad dressing, salt, ginger and pepper; mix well. Add chicken, fruit and celery; mix lightly. Chill. Serve on lettuce-covered platter; top with walnuts. Chill 3 hours. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

name: HEAVENLY SEVEN LAYERED SALAD

ingredients.name: 10 oz. pkg. frozen peas, thawed and drained

steps: In 2 quart serving bowl, layer lettuce, tomatoes, mushrooms, peas, cheese and onions. Spread salad dressing over onions, sealing to edge of bowl; cover. Chill several hours or overnight. Garnish with bacon or shredded cheese, if desired. Makes 8 servings.

name: ORANGE SHERBET SALAD

ingredients.name: pkg. Dream Whip or 1/2 pt. whipping cream

steps: Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water. Add orange sherbet; mix and let stand a few minutes until partially set. Have ready other ingredients, then add to Jell-O mixture and chill. Decorate top with nuts, if desired.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: POTATO SALAD
steps: Mix all ingredients together. Serve hot or cold.

name: RUBY'S FRUIT SALAD
steps: Mix well and refrigerate.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SANDY'S SALAD

ingredients.name: head cauliflower, broken up into small pieces
small pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing

steps: In large bowl mix cauliflower, celery, peas, onion and carrots. In a separate small bowl mix dressing, mayonnaise, sour cream and milk. Then add to large bowl and mix.
by: Sandy Graham Watts, Daughter of Joe & Nancy Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SEVEN LAYER SALAD
steps: Prepare salad in large bowl. Add ingredients, one at a time, as given, each in a separate layer. Do not mix. Make sure the mayonnaise has sealed all holes and edges. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. This salad will keep for 3 or 4 days. Makes 8 generous servings.

name: SNOW WHITE TURKEY SALAD
steps: Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl and set aside. Combine next 5 ingredients in another bowl and mix well. Fold second bowl ingredients into first and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with shredded lettuce and garnish with (optional) toasted almonds, sliced apple, grapes, pineapple or chopped eggs.
by: Kim and George D. Graham, G.D.: Son of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Grandson of George and Josie Graham

name: SPAGHETTI SALAD
steps: Mix all ingredients together except Salad Supreme and dressing. Then add 3 tablespoons Salad Supreme or salad seasoning and 1/2 bottle Italian dressing (or your favorite). I like Kraft Miracle French. Toss to blend flavors and refrigerate. Keeps well. Do not overcook spaghetti

name: STAINED GLASS SALAD

ingredients.name: 3 oz. pkg. each orange, cherry and lime Jell-O

steps: Prepare orange, cherry and lime flavor gelatins separately, dissolving each in 1 cup boiling water and adding 1/2 cup cold water. Pour each flavor into a separate pan. Chill until firm, at least 3 hours. Cut into /2-inch cubes. Dissolve lemon Jell-O and sugar in 1 cup boiling water and add pineapple juice. Chill until slightly thickened. Blend in Cool Whip, add gelatin cubes, pour into a dish and chill overnight or until firm.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: 24 HOUR SALAD

ingredients.name: maraschino cherries (red and green), cut in halves

steps: Cook egg yolks, juice, sugar and salt until it thickens. Let cool. Whip cream. Add cut-up marshmallows, pineapple, nuts and cherries. Stir in sauce mixture. Decorate with nuts and cherries. Put in refrigerator for 24 hours.
by: Colleen Elkins, Wife of George Elkins, Jr., George Jr.: Son of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Grandson of George and Josie Graham

name: WATERGATE SALAD
steps: Mix pineapple juice and pudding mix first; stir until blended well, then mix the rest and refrigerate.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: WILTED LETTUCE OR SPINACH
steps: Wash and cut large bowl of leaf lettuce. Slice 3 or 4 green onions and toss with lettuce. Fry 8 to 12 slices of bacon. Remove from skillet and crumble over lettuce. Leave 1/4 cup bacon drippings in skillet, then add 1/4 cup vinegar and 3 tablespoons sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add 1 beaten egg; stir gently. When egg is set, pour over lettuce. Serve at once.

name: FRUIT SALAD DRESSING
steps: Mix together; place in top of double boiler. Cook until it thickens. Remove from heat and cool. Add beaten egg whites.

name: PAT'S SALAD DRESSING
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: ANN WHISMAN'S SPAGHETTI SAUCE
steps: Fry together Crisco, green pepper, onion and celery, then add ground beef and stir until mixed well. In large bowl combine tomato paste, water, black pepper, sauce, salt and hot pepper. Mix. Cook 2 or 3 hours, slowly.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BARBECUE SAUCE
steps: Combine all ingredients and bring to a boil. Use for chicken, pork or hamburger.

name: FUDGE SAUCE
steps: Heat butter and chocolate in double boiler until melted. Stir in salt, then sugar (4 or 5 portions). Blend sugar throughly after each portion (becomes thick and grainy). Stir in milk very slowly. Cook 5 or 6 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour into glass jar with tight lid. Cover, cool and store in refrigerator. Great for ice cream or cake and keeps well in refrigerator.
by: Mildred Graham, Wife of Richard Graham, Richard: Brother of George Graham

name: GUACAMOLE
steps: Mash 2 pitted and peeled avocados with fork. Stir in sour cream, grated onion, lemon juice, chopped tomato, chili powder, salt and red pepper. Serve with corn chips or crackers.
by: Donna Graham Englert, Daughter of Tom and Pat Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BAKED CHICKEN PARMESAN

ingredients.name: 2 1/2 to 3 lb. broiler-fryer, cut up and skinned
Miracle Whip light reduced calorie salad dressing

steps: Brush chicken with salad dressing; coat with combined remaining ingredients. Place in 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until tender. Makes 3 to 4 servings.
by: Betty J. (Lockard) Wagner, Daughter of George and Bell (Graham) Lockard, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BEEF ROAST WITH MUSHROOM GRAVY

ingredients.name: standing rib, rump or sirloin tip roast

steps: Season meat with salt and pepper. Spike with slivers of fresh garlic. (Cut garlic cloves into thin strips. With ice pick or thin knife, make holes in roast about 1-inch deep and about 2 inches apart. Press garlic strip into holes.) Place roast in aluminum foil lined pan. Do not cover, do not add water, do not baste. Bake in 325° oven for 25 to 30 minutes per pound. Do not open oven door. (I roast mine 25 minutes per pound for a perfect medium roast.) Remove from oven. Cover with foil, let set 20 minutes.

Remove meat from pan. Pour all drippings into saucepan. (If too greasy, spoon some of the grease off.) Pour about 2 cups hot water in pan and shake to get all the goodies off the foil. Add this to saucepan, bring to a boil. Add 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce. Mix cornstarch in a little cold water and stir into broth. This should be a light or thin gravy. Add sliced mushrooms, as much or as little as you like. (I like one pound.) Boil gently for 2 or 3 minutes. Taste to see if you need more salt and pepper.

name: BROCCOLI AND CHICKEN CASSEROLE
steps: Preheat oven to 350°. Cook broccoli and drain. Melt butter in a 2 quart casserole dish. Add broccoli and melted butter; arrange chicken over broccoli and top with cheese. When ready to serve, cover with corn bread mixed according lo box directions and bake for 25 minutes at 350°.
by: Sandy Graham Watts, Daughter of Joe & Nancy Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BUSY DAY PORK CHOPS
steps: Brown chops in margarine. Add onions. Cook chops over moderate heat 20 minutes. Add soup, Worcestershire sauce and milk. Simmer 15 minutes or more. Add chives. Serve with mashed potatoes or noodles. Serves 4 to 6.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: CABBAGE ROLLS
steps: This recipe was given to me by a retired chef from the Biltmore Hotel in Dayton, Ohio.

Mix first 8 ingredients. Wilt cabbage in large pot of hot water, peeling off leaves as they wilt. Large leaves, cut in half. Put 1 large tablespoon filling on 'stem end of cabbage and roll. Tuck in both ends. Put half of sauerkraut in bottom of heavy Dutch oven and place cabbage rolls in layers. Top with remaining sauerkraut, tomato sauce and lard. Cook on low heat or simmer for 1 1/2 hours or until rice is done. I like these with mashed potatoes and rye bread or French bread.

name: CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS

ingredients.name: pieces chicken breast halves, skinned and boned

steps: Cook chicken in gallon of water. Skin and debone. Chunk to bite size and reserve broth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add chicken bouillon and butter to broth. Mix flour and enough milk to mix dough to roll out for dumplings. Roll out thin like pie crust, cut in thin, small pieces and drop in boiling broth. Watch closely (easy to boil over). Always pull dumplings away from outside edge of pan and drop additional batter or dumplings around edge of pot. Cut heat to prevent boiling over, but never let cooking process stop. After adding all of batter, stir bottom of pan and add small pieces of chicken breast and cut heat to as low as possible on stove to slow simmer. Cover with lid and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes. (Will serve about 15 to 20 people.)

If you like broth in dumplings a little thicker, add about 4 large spoons of flour with water and add to broth before dropping in dumplings. Always pour through a strainer to prevent flour lumps. Mom always had a dish of boiled eggs to serve with dumplings and chicken. Cut eggs in half and cover with chicken gravy from dumplings.

name: CHICKEN BREASTS WITH RICE STUFFING

ingredients.name: salt, pepper and paprika to taste
chicken fat (I use butter or margarine)
cooked rice (I like white and wild rice mixed, best)

steps: Rice Stuffing: Brown onions and mushrooms in chicken fat or margarine. Add rice. Season to taste with salt, pepper and paprika.

Bone chicken breasts and pound the meat flat. Place rice stuffing on each breast, roll and fasten in place with skewers. Sprinkle each roll with salt, pepper and paprika. Broil on both sides, cover and bake in 350° oven until meat is tender.
I like to cook my rice in chicken broth.

name: CHICKEN CASSEROLE
steps: Mix all except cracker crumbs. Place in casserole; sprinkle cracker crumbs on top. Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

name: CHICKEN LIVERS
steps: Dredge livers in flour mixed with salt, pepper and oregano. Heat oil in skillet. Add livers. Fry 10 minutes, turning frequently. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over top before serving.

name: CHICKEN MEXICAINE
steps: Cook chicken in water with 1 tablespoon salt. Remove chicken, boil broth to 2 cups and strain. Melt butter in large skillet or Dutch oven. Add onion and garlic. Sauté. Add tomatoes, green pepper, mushrooms, parsley, pepper, chili powder, oregano and chicken broth. Cook, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Mix cornstarch with cold water. Add; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Place chicken in casserole dish. Add sauce, cover with foil and store overnight in refrigerator. Set casserole at room temperature for 2 hours before baking at 400° for 30 minutes. Serve over hot rice or noodles. (I like wild rice best.)

name: CHICKEN PIE
steps: Melt butter. Add flour and salt. Add chicken broth slowly and bring to a boil. Place chicken in pastry lined deep-dish pie pan or casserole dish, then vegetables, onion and pepper. Top with pastry, seal edges and make slits in top of pastry. Bake 30 minutes in 425° oven. Serve hot.

name: CHICKEN RICE CASSEROLE

ingredients.name: chicken breasts, split in half, deboned and skinless
10 1/2 oz. can cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
4 oz. pkg. dehydrated onion soup mix

steps: Blend mushroom soup and milk (reserve 1/2 cup) Combine remaining soup mixture with uncooked rice, mushrooms and onion soup mix and pour into a 2 quart 11 1/2 x 7 1/2 x 1 1/2-inch baking dish. Arrange chicken breasts on top. Pour reserved soup mixture over chicken breasts and sprinkle with paprika. Cover and place in 325 gas oven or 375° electric oven and bake for 1 hour. Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer. Makes 6 servings.

name: CHILI PARLOR CHILI

ingredients.name: hot peppers or 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper (red)
6 oz. can tomato paste (double to make sweeter)

steps: Add hamburger to water in small pieces (do not cook first). Use a potato masher to get the hamburger into small enough pieces. Add all ingredients. Simmer on low for three hours. Add kidney beans at the end of the three hours. This makes a great coney sauce, without the beans. Is is also good over spaghetti with cheese, onions, beans and oyster crackers. Remember to experiment because some people use coffee, tomato juice or beer to make their chili.

name: CORNBREAD SAUSAGE APPLE PIE
steps: Cook sausage over medium heat until browned, stirring to crumble; drain well and set aside. Place oil in a 10-inch cast-iron skillet; heat at 400° for 5 minutes or until very hot. Combine cornbread mix, egg and buttermilk in a large mixing bowl; stir until smooth. Stir in sausage. Pour into heated skillet; bake at 400° for 25 to 30 minutes. Place pie filling, sugar and cinnamon in a small saucepan; cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thoroughly heated. Spread over cornbread. Serve hot. Yields 8 servings.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: DRUNK CHICKEN

ingredients.name: chicken breasts (8 halves), boned and skin removed

steps: Place breasts between wax paper and pound to 1/8-inch thick. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread chicken with half the margarine.. Blend the remaining margarine with the 3 herbs. Cut the cheese into sticks and roll in center of chicken breasts, flour, dip in egg and bread crumbs. Arrange in buttered dish. Melt and pour butter herb mixture over. Bake 1/2 hour. Add wine and baste. Bake another 1/2 hour at 350 degrees.

name: FAMILY MEAT LOAF
steps: Combine ingredients; form into a loaf in shallow baking pan. Bake in 350° oven for 1 hour. Let meat loaf stand 5 minutes before slicing. Makes 6 to 8 servings.
by: Anthony D. Neuhard, Son of Rebecca and Lance D. Neuhard, Grandson of Ruth and Henry Cross, Great Grandson of George and Josie Graham

name: HAMBURGER CASSEROLE
steps: Brown ground chuck. In an oiled casserole dish, slice a layer of potatoes, then a layer of onions, then a layer of hamburger. Salt and pepper each layer. Repeat layering once more. Pour soup on top. Cover and bake at 400° until potatoes are done, about 45 minutes.
Serve with a salad and you don't have all of those ucky pans to wash.

name: HAMBURGER DINNERS
steps: Use this much ingredients for each person. Let each person prepare their own. Use heavy-duty Reynolds Wrap. Place hamburger, chopped onion, sliced potato and salt and pepper on a good size piece of Reynolds Wrap. Then put another piece of Reynolds Wrap on top and roll all the edges together tightly. Place on hot wood chips or on the grill. Turn the Reynolds Wrap package over a couple of times while cooking. Be creative and add carrots or whatever suits your fancy. Enjoy. Can be prepared ahead of time at home, however you should take a cooler on the campout to keep cold until time to cook.
Favorite after school snack is peanut butter spread on a banana. Tastes great!
by: Shannon Graham, Son of James I. and Ella Graham, Grandson of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Great Grandson of George and Josie Graham

name: HAMBURGER FLUFFS
subtitle: (Meatballs)
steps: Mix all ingredients together. Cover and refrigerate for a few hours. Shape with a teaspoon to form an oyster shape. Fry in hot oil until brown. Do not overcrowd. These may be cooked immediately, but the secret of the fluffy texture is in the waiting. Serve with spaghetti and sauce.
by: Ruth Graham Cross, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: HAMBURGER RICE CASSEROLE
steps: Brown hamburger; sauté onions and peppers until half done. Add burger, chili powder and salt. Sauté 10 minutes. Add undrained tomatoes and beans, sugar and rice. Mix well. Place in casserole. Bake covered in a 350° oven for 1 hour. Stir gently; sprinkle with cheese. Cover: bake 5 minutes more.

name: INDIVIDUAL HAM LOAVES
steps: Combine all ingredients in order given, mixing well. Shape into 10 or 12 individual loaves. Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes, basting several times.
Tangy Sauce-- , 1 can tomato sauce, 1 c. brown sugar, 1/2 c. vinegar, 1/2 c. water, pinch of dry mustard.
Simmer for 5 minutes. Pour over ham loaves and baste, while they are baking.

name: JERKY
steps: Make sure to trim all fat from meat. Coat with marinade and refrigerate overnight. Turn over and stir. Place a brown paper bag on a shallow pan. Spread meat on paper. Do not overlap. Bake in 160° oven for 6 to 8 hours until jerky will break.

name: LASAGNA
steps: Fix half box of lasagna noodles in boiling water. Brown ground beef and drain. Add other ingredients and let simmer for about 15 minutes. Begin with sauce, sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese, then a layer of noodles. Add sauce, cheese and noodles. Repeat and end with sauce and sprinkle cheese on top. Bake in 375° oven until cheese is melted.
by: Colleen Elkins, Wife of George Elkins, Jr., George Jr.: Son of George D. and Ruby Elkins, Grandson of George and Josie Graham

name: MRS. WEBSTER'S MEATBALLS
steps: Mix egg, hamburger, carrot, salt, rice, green pepper and onion and form into small balls. Fry meatballs in shortening, then add 1 or 2 cans Campbell's tomato soup and same amount of water. Cook this about 45 minutes slowly.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PORK CHOPS AND POTATO BAKE
steps: Brown chops in dry hot skillet. Remove and place in a large shallow casserole dish and season. Add butter to skillet and sauté onion until limp. Add to chops. Place drained potatoes in spaces between chops. There should be one layer only. Blend flour into fat remaining in skillet. Add the stock and vinegar and cook until thickened. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt, dash of pepper, garlic salt and sour cream. Pour over chops. Bake, covered, in 375° oven for 1/2 hour. Bake uncovered for another 1/2 hour. Makes 4 servings.
by: Ruby Graham Elkins, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: ROAST PORK LOIN AND DRESSING

ingredients.name: pork loin (with or without bone, I like boneless best)

steps: Season roast with salt and pepper, rubbing into meat. Line a roasting pan with aluminum foil. Place pork in pan, fat side up. (If you use a whole loin, score outside edge and bend to form a circle.) Do not cover, do not add water, do not baste. Place in 350° oven for 35 minutes per pound. About 1 hour before done, pour dressing into center of pan and finish baking.

Dressing__ Sauté onion in butter. Add celery, pepper, sage or poultry seasoning, chicken broth and eggs. Mix and pour over bread; toss lightly. Pour into pan with pork and finish baking. (I don't measure, so this is guess work.)

name: SIX LAYER CASSEROLE
steps: Place in layers as given, salt and pepper the potatoes and beef layers. Garnish with green pepper slices. Bake 1 1/2 hours at 350° or until potatoes are done.

name: SLOPPY JOES
steps: Brown hamburger and pork. Add onion; sauté. Add all other ingredients and simmer 1 hour. Serve on buns.

name: SPAGHETTI
steps: Combine beef, pork, bread crumbs, Parmesan, 1 tablespoon parsley, garlic, milk, eggs, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper; form into 1 1/2-inch balls. Pan-fry until brown in hot fat with minced onion. Blend in flour, then add remaining ingredients and simmer about 1 hour. Serve hot over drained spaghetti.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SPAGHETTI PARMESAN

ingredients.name: 16 oz. pkg. spaghetti, cooked and drained

steps: Heat sauce according to label directions. When heated, stir in Parmesan cheese. Simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour sauce over spaghetti. Sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese, if desired.

name: SOLE
subtitle: (Fish)

ingredients.name: sole fillets, cut in half lengthwise

steps: Mix mushrooms, parsley, onion, salt and pepper and spread in a buttered shallow casserole. Place fish fillets on top, overlapping thin ends in the center. Salt and pepper. Pour 1/2 cup dry white wine over and 1/2 cup clam juice. Cover with buttered wax paper. Place on burner and heat to simmer. Place in oven at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.
Sauce-- , juice from fish (keep fish hot), 2 1/2 Tbsp. butter, 2 1/2 Tbsp. flour, 4 Tbsp. cream, 1/2 c. Hollandaise Sauce (about)

Boil fish broth. Make roux of butter and flour. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the fish juice. Stir well with wire whip. Add cream and Hollandaise Sauce. Drain fish again into sauce. This should be thick and creamy. Pour sauce over fish Serves 4. I like this served with rice, salad, broccoli and corn and rolls.

name: STUFFED CHICKEN BREASTS
steps: Sauté chicken breasts in skillet. On chicken breasts, put 1 large tablespoon spinach. Sprinkle with Feta or Greek cheese. Roll and skewer with toothpick. Roll in beaten egb, then in dry bread crumbs. Brown in oil. Arrange in casserole and put in oven at 350' for 30 minutes.
Sauce-- , 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, 1 c. sliced mushrooms, 1 Tbsp. flour, 1 c. dry white wine, 1 c. chicken broth, 1 Tbsp. lemon juice

Pour off oil and use same skillet. Add butter or margarine. Add mushrooms; sauté. Add flour and brown to a roux. Add wine, broth and lemon juice. Cook and pour over chicken. Return to oven or 30 more minutes. Garnish with same kind of green stuff.

name: STUFFED GREEN PEPPERS
steps: Soak rice in water for 20 minutes; drain. Combine rice with beef. Add 1 teaspoon salt, pepper, egg, onion and steak sauce. Cut off tops of peppers; remove core and seeds. Wash, drain and stuff with beef mixture. Place peppers upright in saucepan. Blend soup with cold water. Pour over and around peppers. Simmer, covered, for 1 hour. Serve with tomato soup as sauce.

name: SUMMER SAUSAGE
steps: Mix well and refrigerate, covered, overnight. Knead each day for 3 days. On the 4th day, roll into balls, about 1 pound each. Make rolls smaller around and longer than sausage rolls. Put on broiler pan and bake at 200° for 6 to 8 hours. Cool and wrap in foil; freeze.

name: SWEET AND SOUR SAUCED PORK

ingredients.name: 8 oz. can pineapple chunks in natural juice

steps: Drain juice from pineapple into saucepan. Reserve pineapple chunks. Combine juice, catsup, cornstarch and sugar. Cook and stir until mixture thickens.

Meanwhile, panbroil chops in lightly oiled frying pan over medium heat 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Season with salt. Add pineapple chunks and lemon slices to sauce. Heat through. Serve sauce over chops. Serves 2.

name: SWISS TURKEY QUICHE
steps: I always add more green pepper and onions. Preheat oven to 425°. Bake shell 8 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350°. Toss flour with cheese and bouillon. Add remaining ingredients, pour into pie shell and bake 40 to 45 minutes. Top with onion rings last 5 minutes of baking time. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: TACO SALAD
steps: Brown meat and cool. Combine meat, onion, cheese beans and lettuce. Add dressing and chips just before serving.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: TEXAS CHILI
steps: In a large heavy pan, heat oil and brown beef cubes on all sides. Add onions, green pepper and garlic and fry them with beef for about 5 minutes. Add all the remaining ingredients except beans and simmer the chili for 1 1/2 hours or until the meat is tender. Add beans and simmer 30 minutes longer.

name: TUNA AND BROCCOLI CASSEROLE

ingredients.name: 10 1/2 oz. can cream of mushroom soup

steps: Cook broccoli 3 minutes; drain and place in 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Cover with tuna. Combine soup and milk and pour over tuna. Sprinkle with chips. Bake in preheated oven at 400° for 15 minutes.

name: OYSTER PUDDING
steps: Mix cracker crumbs and melted butter. Spread 1/3 of the crumbs in a pie plate. Drain oysters, reserving 1/4 cup liquid. Spread 1/2 oysters over crackers in plate, then 1/3 crumbs. Spread the rest of the oysters. Mix cream, oyster liquid and Worcestershire sauce. Pour over oysters. Top with remaining crumbs. Bake for 45 minutes in 350° oven.

name: BAKED BEANS
steps: In a skillet, lightly brown meat, green pepper, celery and onions. Add remaining ingredients; mix thoroughly. Bake 1 hour at 375°.

name: BANANA PEPPERS CRESPO
subtitle: (Fried)
steps: Combine flour, salt, baking powder and chili powder. Add milk; stir to form a batter. Wash peppers and remove core, veins and seeds. Cut into halves: coat peppers evenly with batter on both sides. Fry until golden brown and drain on paper towel. Serve warm.

name: BROCCOLI CASSEROLE WITH ONION RINGS
steps: Fry bacon; drain and crumble. Cook broccoli in boiling, salted water until tender. Arrange in casserole dish Add bacon drippings and combine soup and water. Bring to a boil. Pour over broccoli. Top with cheese, onion rings and bacon. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.

name: BROCCOLI SUPREME

ingredients.name: can French fried onion rings or pkg. French fried frozen onion rings

steps: Prepare broccoli according to package. Cook 5 minutes; drain. Put into greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Mix soup with milk. Pour over cheese. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. Remove from oven; top with onion rings. Bake 8 to 10 minutes longer or until onions are brown.

name: CAROLINA SWEET POTATO
steps: Topping-- , 1 c. brown sugar, 1/2 c. self-rising flour, 5 1/2 Tbsp. butter (softened), 1 c. pecans (chopped)
Combine all ingredients except topping. Pour into greased 2 quart casserole. Add topping and bake at 300° for 35 minutes.
by: Betty Lockard Wagner, Daughter of Belle and George Lockard, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: CAULIFLOWER AND BROCCOLI CASSEROLE
steps: Blanch broccoli, cauliflower and carrots in hot water for 2 minutes; drain. Add remaining ingredients except onions and cheese. Pour into casserole and bake covered at 350° for 30 minutes. Top with 1/2 cup shredded Swiss cheese and 1/2 can French. fried onions. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes.

name: FESTIVE CORN PUDDING
steps: Combine eggs, flour and sugar; beat well. Add milk, corn and salt. Melt butter in baking dish; add corn mixture. Bake at 400° for 45 to 60 minutes or until firm.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: NANCY'S BAKED BEANS
steps: Fry bacon brown and add green pepper and onion. Fry a few minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until done.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Ruby Graham Elkins, Daughters of George and Josie Graham

name: PARMESAN POTATOES

ingredients.name: large potatoes, peeled and cut in 1/8ths

steps: Mix flour, cheese, salt and pepper in plastic bag. Put potatoes in bag and coat well. Melt oleo in oblong casserole dish. Spread potatoes in single layer. Sprinkle with remaining cheese mixture. Bake 1 hour in 375° oven; turn once. Do not cover.

name: POTLUCK POTATOES

ingredients.name: pkg. frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed

steps: Grease a 13 × 9 x 2-inch baking pan with a portion of 1/2 cup butter; set aside. Combine remaining butter with next 7 ingredients; stir well. Spoon mixture into buttered baking dish. Sprinkle corn flakes over mixture and pour melted butter on top. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: SCALLOPED CABBAGE
steps: Cover and cook cabbage in small amount of water for 3 minutes; drain. Melt butter and blend in flour. Add milk and salt. Cook and stir until thickened. Pour 1/2 sauce in casserole. Place cabbage over sauce. Cover cabbage with remaining sauce and top with bread crumbs. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

name: STEWED TOMATOES
steps: Cook until vegetables are tender. Serve hot with croutons.

name: BEER BATTER
steps: Mix dry ingredients together. Add egg. Gradually add beer, using about 3/4 can. Dip fish, cauliflower, mushrooms and onions. Deep-fry until golden brown. Oil should be 375° to 400°.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BEER BISCUITS

ingredients.name: warm beer (you may use nonalcoholic beer)

steps: Dissolve sugar in the beer and add it to the biscuit mix. Mix the dough as you would with any biscuits and bake them as you normally would any biscuits.
If making them from scratch is more your style, just add the beer instead of the liquid called for in the recipe. Be sure to add the amount of sugar as listed above. They're wonderful!

name: BEER ROLLS
steps: Mix thoroughly; pour in muffin tins and bake at 450° until brown.

name: BLUEBERRY PANCAKES AND SAUCE
steps: Mix everything well except blueberries. Drain 1 can blueberries. Reserve liquid. Rinse blueberries with 1/2 cup water. Add water to blueberry liquid enough to make 1 1/2 cups. Add 1/2 blueberries to pancake mixture (carefully). Fry pancakes in a little oil.
Sauce-- , 1 1/2 c. liquid from blueberries, 1/2 c. sugar, 1 1/2 Tbsp. cornstarch, 1/4 c. orange juice or juice of 1 orange, dash of salt
Boil until slightly thick. Add rest of blueberries and serve on hot pancakes with a glob of butter.

name: BREAD STUFFING
steps: Use 1 cup bread cubes for each pound of turkey. Add bread cubes lo butter, celery, onions, salt and pepper and mix well. Cook giblets with a little carrot, celery and onion in broth. Add 2 beaten eggs. Combine with bread mixture. Bake in shallow pan for 45 minutes at 350° or until brown.

name: BROCCOLI BREAD

ingredients.name: box frozen chopped broccoli, thawed and drained

steps: Mix all ingredients together, adding cornbread mix last. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes in 9 x 13-inch pan.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: DADDY'S FAVORITE PANCAKES
steps: Sift flour, sugar and baking soda together. Beat egg, oil and buttermilk together and add to dry ingredients. Mix well. Cook on 350° griddle until golden. Serve with dollop of butter and warm syrup.
Hint__ Beat lots of air into liquid ingredients before adding to dry ingredients.
by: Nichole M. Neuhard, Daughter of Rebecca and Lance D. Neuhard, Granddaughter of Ruth and Henry Cross, Great Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: DINNER ROLLS
steps: In large bowl mix 1/2 cup warm water and yeast. Stir and let stand about 5 minutes. Stir and add sugar, salt and 1 1/2 cups warm water. Add 1 beaten egg. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add 3 cups flour one at a time; beat well. Add melted butter. Mix in 2 more cups flour and mix real well. Knead on floured board for about 5 minutes. Place in well greased bowl and turn the dough over so the dough is greased on top. Cover lightly and let rise in a warm place until doubled. Punch down with buttered hands. Pinch off about 1/4 cup of dough; roll in hands until smooth. Place in buttered pan. Cover and let rise until doubled. Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes or until nice and brown.

name: EASY BRAN MUFFINS
steps: Combine first 5 ingredients. Beat eggs, add buttermilk and oil. Mix with flour mixture, just to moisten well. Place in covered bowl, store in refrigerator until ready to use. Batter can be kept up to a month. To bake, spoon into greased muffin pans, filling 2/3 full. Bake at 400° for 12 to 15 minutes.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: MY MOTHER-IN-LAW'S BISCUITS
steps: Using your hand, mash lard into flour until pieces are size of your thumbnail. Mix buttermilk and water. Pour over flour mixture and gently mix with your hand, just until moistened. Turn onto a floured board and knead 3 or 4 times. Roll out to 1/2-inch thick. Cut out and place on greased pan. Bake 15 to 20 minutes in 450° oven, or until brown.

name: POTATO BREAD
steps: Peel and dice 2 small potatoes, cover with water and cook until done. In the meantime, sift flour onto 2 sheets of waxed paper or dough board. In large mixer bowl, measure the sugar, shortening and salt. When potatoes are done, measure 2 1/2 cups of potato water and pour over shortening, sugar and salt. Stir to dissolve. When cooled to slightly warmer than lukewarm, beat egg with whisk and add to cooled mixture. Add yeast and stir until dissolved. Add 3 cups flour and beat with mixer (use regular beater) until all lumps are gone and it's well mixed. Add 1 cup of flour and beat again with mixer. Add the last 2 cups of flour, 1 cup at a time, and mix each in by hand. Turn out on well floured waxed paper or dough board and kneads by hand, turning often until the dough doesn't pick up any more flour. Put into greased bowl and let rise until double in size. Can let rise twice, but not necessary. This amount makes 3 loaves of bread or 2 loaves and a 6-roll pan of rolls. Butter top of bread and pierce with fork several times. Let rise until double in size and bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Bake rolls for about 10 minutes.

name: QUAIL OR WILD LIFE BREADING
steps: For fish or chops, use 1 teaspoon less than above on spices.
Blend milk and eggs well. Dip meat in milk and egg mixture and roll in meal and spices.
by: Fonzie Graham (1983), Son of George and Josie Graham

name: QUICK-MIX COFFEE-MIX CAKE
steps: Open biscuits, dip biscuits in melted butter, then in mixture of sugar, cinnamon and nuts. Arrange, overlapping, in 9-inch round pan. Bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes.

name: RAISED WAFFLES
steps: Dissolve yeast in water. Add all other ingredients. Beat until smooth. Cover and let rise about 1 1/2 hours. Stir. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Bake in waffle iron. Serve with butter and syrup. Makes 8 to 7 waffles or 24 small waffles.

name: ROSE'S BUTTER ROLLS
steps: Mix together yeast and water. Mix together butter and sugar. Add cold water, salt and flour. Mix all ingredients; let sit in refrigerator overnight. Roll out like biscuit and cut. Let raise for 2 hours and bake at 400° until done.
by: Rose Graham, Wife of Alvan Graham, Alvan: Son of George and Josie Graham

name: SOFT PRETZELS

ingredients.name: enough coarse salt to sprinkle on top

steps: Preheat oven to 400°. Add yeast, salt, sugar and warm water together in a large bowl. Mix into flour; knead to make a soft dough. Do not let it rise. Cut into pieces and form into pretzel shapes. Place on a foil covered cookie sheet and brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake 15 minutes or until light brown. Makes 3 to 6 dozen depending on size.

name: SOUR CREAM CORNBREAD
steps: Mix and bake in iron skillet at 400° until golden brown.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: SPOON BREAD
steps: Bring milk to a boil. Remove from heat and add cornmeal. Stir until thickened. Add other ingredients and mix well. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until center is done.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: STICKY BUNS
steps: Measure warm water into a cup and sprinkle on yeast and 1 tablespoon granulated sugar. Set aside. Add salt to milk and scald. Cool to lukewarm. Stir yeast mixture and add it to milk, then gradually beat in 2 cups flour, blending well. Cover and set aside in warm place to get bubbly.

Meanwhile, beat shortening, 3/4 cup granulated sugar and eggs until very creamy and smooth. When yeast is bubbly, add sugar and egg mixture, a small amount at a time, until well blended. Then add remaining flour, 3/4 cup at a time, beating lightly after each addition until all flour is added. Dough will be sticky and soft, but don't be alarmed, don't add too much flour. Cover and let rise until double in bulk.

Turn out on floured board and knead to get air bubbles out and then roll out quite thin to rectangles shape. Spread with melted butter and sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon; add raisins, if desired. Roll up jelly roll style and cut into slices 12-inch thick. Place in two 8-inch square pans that have been greased and have Sticky Mixture on bottom; let rise until doubled and bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Turn out from pans as soon as removed from oven. Makes 2 dozen.
Sticky Mixture-- , 1/2 c. butter (melted), 1 c. dark Karo syrup, 1 c. brown sugar, 1 1/2 c. pecans (optional)
Combine ingredients and heat until well blended. Pour into 2 greased 8-inch square pans.

name: SWEET ROLLS
steps: Soften yeast in warm water; scald milk. Add butter, sugar and salt. Cool until lukewarm. Add 2 cups flour. Beat well. Add yeast and eggs. Mix well. Then add the remaining flour. Knead well. Place in a buttered bowl and cover. Let rise until double in bulk. Then roll or cut and let rise until double in bulk and bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Susan Graham Neff

name: WAFFLE
steps: Mix all ingredients together and cook in a waffle iron.
by: Belle Graham Lockard, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: APPLE CREAM CAKE
steps: Beat together cream cheese, 1/4 cup sugar and 1 egg and set aside. Whisk 3 eggs and oil together. Combine dry ingredients; add oil and eggs. Mix just until moist. Fold in apples and nuts. Reserve 2 cups of batter. Put rest in greased and floured tube or Bundt pan. Spoon cream cheese over and add rest of batter. Bake 50 to 55 minutes at 350°.

name: BETTER THAN SEX CAKE

ingredients.name: Duncan Hines butter yellow cake mix

steps: Beat first 5 ingredients together. Add all other ingredients together and pour into greased and floured Bundt pan and bake at 350° for 1 hour.

name: GERMAN FRESH APPLE CAKE
steps: Whip until foamy eggs, oil, sugar and vanilla. Mix flour, soda, cinnamon and salt. Add apples and nuts last. Bake at 350° for 1 hour. Cool and frost.
Frosting-- , 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, 1 tsp. vanilla, 3 Tbsp. margarine (melted), 2 c. powdered sugar
Mix until creamy; spread on cooled cake. This recipe is great without the icing also.
by: James Gearld Graham, Son of James I. and Ella Graham, Grandson of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Great Grandson of George and Josie Graham

name: JEWISH APPLE CAKE
steps: Makes thick dough. Peel and slice 4 or 5 apples. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cinnamon and 5 tablespoons sugar. Starting with dough, alternate layers of dough and apples, ending with apples. Put into greased and floured tube pan. Bake 1 1/2 hours at 350°. Sprinkle with powdered sugar while warm.
by: Pat Graham, Wife of Tom Graham, Tom: Son of George and Josie Graham

name: BUTTERMILK CHOCOLATE CAKE
steps: Sift together flour, sugar and baking soda. Melt butter; add cocoa and water. Stir well, then bring to a boil and pour over dry ingredients. Add buttermilk, eggs and vanilla and mix well by hand. Mixture will be very thin. Pour into well greased and floured 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Bake at 400° for about 20 minutes.
Icing-- , 1/2 stick butter, 1/3 c. milk, 2 c. confectioner's sugar, 1 c. brown sugar, 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla

Melt butter in heavy saucepan. Add brown sugar; cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for a few minutes. Add milk; bring to a boil. Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm. Add vanilla and confectioners sugar; beat until smooth. Spread on cool cake.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Wife of Fonzie Graham, Fonzie: Son of George and Josie Graham

name: CARROT CAKE
steps: Beat eggs until fluffy. Add oil; mix. Add sugar and mix well. Mix washed and drained raisins with dry ingredients. Add carrots, pecans and egg mixture and mix well. Bake in greased and floured 9x 13-inch cake pan at 350° for 1 hour. Frost with cream cheese frosting, if desired.
by: Belle Graham Lockard, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: JANNIE'S CARROT CAKE
steps: Preheat oven to 350°. Grease and flour 9 × 13-inch pan. Mix all ingredients. Pour into cake pan and bake for 50 to 60 minutes.
Icing-- , 1/2 c. margarine, 1 lb. powdered sugar, 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, 1 tsp. vanilla, nuts (optional)
Mix until creamy. Frost cool cake.

name: CHEESE CAKE
steps: Mix graham cracker crumbs, margarine and sugar and press into pie plate. Cream cream cheese, pudding and milk. Pour filling into graham cracker crust. If desired, add 1 can cherry pie filling and whipped cream. Makes 1 (9-inch) pie.

name: CHESS CHEESE CAKE
steps: Melt butter and add cake mix and 1 egg. Press in pan. Mix cream cheese, confectioners sugar and 3 eggs well. Pour over batter and bake at 325° for 1 hour.

name: EASY CHOCOLATE CHIP CAKE
steps: Mix cake mix, milk, eggs, oil and dry pudding mix. Beat until well blended. Fold in chocolate chips and all except 1/4 cup of the grated chocolate. Pour into well greased and floured 9-inch tube pan. Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool on rack. Mix remaining 1/4 cup grated chocolate with confectioners sugar and sprinkle on top of cake.

name: CHOCOLATE ORANGE CAKE
steps: Bake cake as directed on package, adding cinnamon to mix. Bake in 2 (8-inch) cake pans. Cool and split each layer in half to make 4 layers.
Filling and Icing-- , 1 c. butter, 2 c. powdered sugar, 1/2 tsp. orange peel (grated), 3 Tbsp. orange juice, 1 can mandarin orange slices (1/2 c. chopped)

Cream all filling and icing ingredients except oranges. Spread icing between layers and sprinkle chopped oranges over each layer. Stack layers and use same icing to frost top and sides. May decorate top with orange slices.

name: CHOCOLATE SHEET CAKE
subtitle: (Makes One 15 x 10-Inch Cake)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°. In small saucepan, melt 1 cup margarine. Stir in 1/4 cup cocoa, then water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. In large mixer bowl, combine flour, brown sugar, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Add cocoa mixture and beat well. Stir in 1/3 cup Eagle Brand milk, eggs and vanilla. Pour into greased 15 x 10-inch jelly roll pan. Bake 15 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched. In small saucepan, melt remaining 1/4 cup margarine. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup cocoa and Eagle Brand milk. Stir in confectioners sugar and nuts. Spread on warm cake.

name: CREAM CAKE
steps: Melt margarine in baking pan. Mix flour and sugar well. Add all other ingredients; mix and bake at 350° for 25 minutes. Top with berries, whipped cream or whatever.
by: Roxanne Samples Redick, Friend of Rebecca K. Neuhard

name: DIRT CAKE
steps: Blend cookies in blender to look like dirt. Beat cream cheese, margarine and powdered sugar until fluffy. Mix pudding as directed on package with 3 1/2 cups milk.
In new plastic 8-inch flower pot, layer ingredients, starting with "dirt." Spread "dirt" on top. Add a plastic flower and serve with spade. Make the night before using.

name: DOROTHY'S LEMON CAKE

ingredients.name: box lemon Jell-O, dissolved in 1 c. boiling water

steps: Bake cake at 350° for 1 hour in tube pan.
While cake is hot, spread on a mixture of 1/4 cup ReaLemon and 1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar.
by: Dorothy Graham, Wife of Ford Graham, Ford: Son of George and Josie Graham

name: ELLA'S BANANA STRAWBERRY SPLIT CAKE

ingredients.name: 16 oz. can crushed pineapple, drained (keep juice)
large can whipped cream or 2 containers frozen whipped topping

steps: Use a 9 x 13-inch cake pan. For first layer, mix graham crackers and 2/3 cup melted butter and press into bottom of pan. For second layer, beat until firm, about 15 minutes, the rest of butter, powdered sugar, eggs and vanilla. Spread over graham crackers. For third layer, slice and dip in pineapple juice and drain 3 bananas. Then add the above. Then add fresh sliced strawberries for the fourth layer. Add well drained, crushed pineapple for the fifth layer. Add whipped cream for the sixth layer. Add chopped nuts and maraschino cherries. Refrigerate for firmness.

name: FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE
steps: Mix together sugar, eggs, fruit cocktail, salt, soda and flour. Pour in pan. Sprinkle on top, brown sugar, nuts and coconut. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes. Leave in pan.
Icing-- , 3/4 c. sugar, 1/2 c. Pet milk, 1/2 c. coconut, 1 stick butter
Boil icing ingredients 2 minutes and put on cake.

name: ITALIAN CREAM COCONUT CAKE
steps: Cream butter; gradually add sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Add egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Combine flour and soda; add to creamed mixture. Stir in 1 cup coconut and 1/2 cup pecans. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form; fold into batter. Pour mixture into 3 greased and floured 8-inch cake pans. Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes; turn out onto wire racks and cool completely.

Spread Cream Cheese Frosting between layers; sprinkle each layer with 1/3 cup coconut and 1/2 cup pecans. Spread remaining frosting on top and sides of cake and sprinkle top with remaining 1/3 cup coconut.
Cream Cheese Frosting-- , 1/2 c. butter or margarine (softened), 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese (softened), 1 (16 oz.) pkg. powdered sugar, 2 tsp. vanilla
Combine butter and cream cheese, beating until light and fluffy. Add powdered sugar and vanilla; beat until smooth.
by: Nell Tyra Graham, Wife of Fonzie Graham, Fonzie: Son of George and Josie Graham

name: LEMON AND LIME SUPREME REFRIGERATOR CAKE
steps: Dissolve Jell-O into 3/4 cup boiling water. Add 1/2 cup cold water; let cool. Bake cake per directions; let cool Punch holes into cake and pour Jell-O into holes. Mix topping, milk and instant pudding together and frost cake. Store in refrigerator. Great summer dessert.

name: MEXICAN FRUIT CAKE
steps: Mix well with a wooden spoon. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Frost while hot.
Icing-- , 1 stick oleo/margarine (softened), 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese (softened), 1 tsp. vanilla, 1 lb. box confectioner's sugar
Beat all together and frost.

name: MISSISSIPPI MUD CAKE
steps: Mix sugar and cocoa. Then add butter and cream together with egg and vanilla. Slowly add flour, then coconut and nuts (pecans). Will be like brownies. Pour in a 13 x 17-inch cake pan that is greased and floured. Bake for 40 minutes in a 350° oven. While warm, ice cake with Marshmallow Creme and let cake cool completely. The Marshmallow Creme will be firm. Ice with icing.
Icing-- , 1/3 c. cocoa, 1 stick margarine, 1 box confectioner's sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla, 1/2 c. milk, nuts (optional)
by: Leah Graham, Daughter of George D. and Sue Graham, Granddaughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Great Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: MY FAVORITE JAM CAKE
steps: Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and jam and beat thoroughly. Sift flour; measure and sift with baking soda, salt and spices. Add alternately with milk to finish mixture. Beat thoroughly. Bake in moderate oven (375°) about 45 minutes. I sometimes add nuts (2/3 cup), raisins (1/2 cup) or dates may be added.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: NO BAKE FRUIT CAKE

ingredients.name: box Betty Crocker fluffy white frosting

steps: Bake cake and crumble in large pan. Add fruits and pecans. Mix frosting as directed, then mix in cake and fruit mixture. Line a tube pan with foil. Pack cake in pan; pack tight. Cover cake with foil and refrigerate for 24 hours.
I like candied pineapple, lemon peel and extra dates and raisins and nuts to make 4 cups instead of candied fruit. This cake will keep for a long long time.

name: OATMEAL CAKE
steps: Mix oats and boiling water; set aside. Let set 20 minutes in large mixing bowl. Cream together sugars and butter. Add beaten eggs. Pour in oat mixture. Add dry ingredients. Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
Sauce-- , 1 c. brown sugar, 1 stick butter, 1 c. evaporated milk, 1 c. flour
Pour sauce over cake. Let broil for 2 or 3 minutes.

name: OLD FASHION DRIED APPLE STACK CAKE

ingredients.name: plain flour (may have to add more)

steps: Cream shortening and sugar together. Add eggs, molasses and buttermilk and mix well. Sift flour, baking powder, salt, soda and ginger together. Add to other mixture. Mix well and add vanilla. Mix dough and roll out as for pastry. Cut to fit 9-inch cake pan (I use cake pan for cutting out pastry). Place on baking sheet and bake at 350° about 10 to 12 minutes. When cool, stack layers with dried apple mixture; same as for fried apple pies.
by: Ruby Graham Elkins, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: ORANGE SLICE CAKE

ingredients.name: orange slice candy, cut up fine

steps: Sift 3 1/2 cups flour and salt together and set aside. Combine candy, coconut, pecans and dates with 1/2 cup flour and set aside. Cream butter, sugar and eggs, beating after each addition. Combine soda and buttermilk and add to flour mixture. Stir into batter. Add candy mixture to other ingredients and put into 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 250° for 3 hours.
Glaze-- , 1 c. orange juice, 2 c. confectioner's sugar
Mix well and pour over cake when cake is hot and taken out of oven. Cool. Refrigerate and let stand overnight before serving.

name: PAT'S FAST CAKE
steps: Put eggs into a cup, add oil and finish filling cup with cream. Add all ingredients and mix. Bake at 350° until done. Makes one 8-inch layer.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham, Given to Nora by Pat Graham

name: PINA COLADA CHEESECAKE

ingredients.name: dark Jamaican rum or 2 tsp. rum extract

steps: Prepare Coconut Crust. Mix gelatin and 1/2 cup sugar in saucepan. Add pineapple juice. Let stand 1 minute. Heat over low until gelatin dissolves (5 minutes). Remove from heat. Add yolks, one at a time. Beat well after each. Cool slightly. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Blend in gelatin mixture with rum and coconut extract. Chill quickly by setting mixture over bowl of ice water; stir until slightly thickened. Beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar until stiff peaks form. Fold into gelatin. Turn into prepared crust. Refrigerate overnight. In a saucepan, combine undrained pineapple with 2 tablespoons sugar and cornstarch. Cook, stirring until boils and thickens. Cool. Spoon over cheesecake. Serves 8 to 10.
Coconut Crust-- , 1 1/2 c. vanilla wafer crumbs, 1 c. flaked coconut, 1/3 c. melted butter
Mix vanilla wafer crumbs with coconut. Stir in melted butter. Press in bottom and side of 8 or 9-inch spring-form pan. Chill until ready to use.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: POUND CAKE
steps: Cream margarine until light. Cream in sugar and beat until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in 1 cup flour, then add flavorings. Continue adding flour, alternating with ginger ale. Beat batter until smooth. Pour into two greased and floured 9 x 5-inch loaf pans or 1 tube pan. Bake in preheated 275° oven for 1 hour and 45 minutes; let cool in pan.
Note__ Baking will be longer in tube pan. Test cake with toothpick. This is soooo good.
The best and cheapest. Makes 2 loaves. (Ann Landers)
by: Ruth Graham Cross, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PUMPKIN ORANGE CHEESECAKE

ingredients.name: 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated milk)
orange flavored liqueur or orange juice

steps: Preheat oven to 300°. Combine crumbs and margarine. Press firmly on bottom and halfway up side of 9-inch springform pan. In large mixer bowl, add remaining ingredients except whipped topping; mix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched (center will be slightly soft). Cool to room temperature. Chill. Serve with whipped topping. Refrigerate leftovers.

name: RED VELVET CAKE
steps: Mix soda and vinegar and set aside. Cream sugar and shortening. Add eggs and beat well. Make paste of cocoa and part of the food coloring and add to creamed mixture. Add balance of coloring, buttermilk and flour to which salt has been added. Add vinegar mixture and vanilla. Mix well, but don't beat. Pour into greased and floured 8-inch pans and bake 30 minutes at 350°. Cool.
Frosting-- , 1 c. sweet milk, 3 Tbsp. flour, 1 c. oleo (aka margarine), 1 c. sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla
Cook milk with flour until thick. Cool. Cream oleo, sugar and vanilla. Mix with cooled mixture and beat for 2 minutes.

name: RED VELVET CAKE
steps: Cream sugar and margarine. Add eggs; beat 1 minute. Add vanilla. Make paste of cocoa and food coloring and add to batter. Add salt. Alternate adding flour and buttermilk to batter. Mix soda and vinegar and add to batter. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes.
Icing-- , 1 c. sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla, 3 Tbsp. flour, 1 c. margarine, 1 c. milk
Cook flour and milk in double boiler until thick, stirring well. Cool. Cream sugar, margarine and vanilla until fluffy. Add all ingredients together and beat at low speed. Frost cooled cake.
by: Debbie Cross Booker, Daughter of Ruth and Henry Cross, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SHEATH CAKE
steps: Mix sugar and flour. Heat butter, cocoa, water and shortening in pan until it reaches the boiling point. Pour hot mixture over the dry ingredients and mix well. Add butter, milk, eggs, soda and vanilla. Pour into 11 x 15-inch pan. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.
Icing-- , 1 stick margarine, 6 Tbsp. milk, 1 tsp. vanilla, 3 Tbsp. cocoa, 1 box powdered sugar, 1/2 c. chopped nuts
Heat margarine, cocoa and milk to boil. Blend vanilla and nuts.

name: TURTLE CAKE
steps: Mix dry cake mix, 1/2 cup milk and margarine. Batter will be thick. Place 1/2 batter in 9 x 12-inch cake pan (glass pan works better). Drop oven temperature to 325°. Bake 10 minutes. Cool. Melt caramels with 1/2 cup evaporated milk. Pour caramel mixture over cake. Spread chocolate chips and nuts over caramel mixture. Put remainder of batter by spoonfuls on top and bake 20 minutes. Cool. Ice with chocolate icing.
by: Linda Hollon Honaker, Daughter of Nora and Ova Hollon, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: WACKY CAKE
steps: Mix all ingredients together in ungreased 8 × 8-inch pan. Bake at 325° for 25 to 35 minutes.

name: MY FAVORITE CHOCOLATE FROSTING
steps: Place all ingredients except vanilla in saucepan and heat on low heat until chocolate melts. Turn heat up to medium and cook until mixture bubbles all over. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and beat to spreading consistency.

name: BROWN SUGAR FROSTING
steps: Place first 3 ingredients in saucepan, bring to a rolling boil, count to 60 (about 1 minute) and remove from burner. Add butter and vanilla; beat until glossy and spread on cake.

name: DATE BALLS
steps: Melt butter in heavy pan or skillet. Add sugar, egg and dates. Cook 2 minutes after it starts to boil. Take off heat; stir in nuts, Rice Krispies and vanilla. Cool. Roll into balls. Roll in coconut.
by: Susan Graham Neff, Nell Tyra Graham

name: DATE NUT COOKIES
steps: Combine dates, granulated sugar and water. Cook over low heat until thick. Cool. Add nuts. Set aside. Cream shortening, brown sugar, eggs and all ingredients except the date mixture. Dough should be rather stiff. Divide into three equal parts. Roll each part very thin, spread date mixture and roll into rolls like a jelly roll. Wrap in wax paper. Freeze or chill in refrigerator overnight. Slice and bake at 375° for about 11 minutes.

name: FROZEN CHOCOLATE CHIP LOAF
steps: Preheat oven to 375°. Slice roll 1/4-inch thick. Lay in bottom of ungreased 9 x 13-inch pan. Underbake to a light golden brown. Bake about 12 to 15 minutes. Put caramels in pan at low heat. When melted, add 1/4 cup milk and stir. Sprinkle chocolate chips over warm dough and spread caramel mixture over all. Sprinkle nuts last. Chill until cold. Cut into 36 bars. Wrap each bar individually.
by: Cindy Swartzel Good, Friend of Rebecca K. Neuhard

name: GINGER GRAHAM'S CREAMS
steps: Cream shortening and sugar. Add beaten eggs, molasses and water. Beat well. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes. Frost when cool.
Icing-- , 6 Tbsp. butter, 1 tsp. vanilla, 3 Tbsp. hot water, confectioner's sugar
Melt butter; add hot water and vanilla. Thicken with confectioners sugar.

name: GOLDEN GRAHAM S'MORES

ingredients.name: 11.5 oz. pkg. Nestle milk chocolate morsels
12 oz. pkg. Golden Grahams cereal (9 c.)

steps: Grease rectangular pan (13 x 9-inches). Heat syrup, margarine and morsels to boiling. Stir constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour over cereal in bowl and toss until coated. Fold in marshmallows, one cup at a time. Press into pan with buttered back of spoon. Let stand one hour. Cut into 2-inch squares. Store, covered, at room temperature up to two days. Makes 24 squares.
by: Edna Graham Halsey, Daughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: GRANDMA COOKIES
subtitle: (Bell Hollon to Josie Graham)

ingredients.name: flavoring to taste (I use vanilla and lemon, 2 tsp. each or vanilla and almond)

steps: Do not substitute.
Mix all together to a stiff dough and roll on a floured board. Cut into shapes. Bake at 400° for about 10 to 12 minutes until light brown.
by: Bell "Grandma" Hollon, Mother of Josie Hollon Graham

name: HELLO DOLLY BARS
steps: No mixing bowl needed. Take a 9 x 13-inch loaf cake pan and melt the butter in the pan. Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs over butter. Sprinkle coconut over the crumbs. Sprinkle butterscotch bits over coconut. Sprinkle chocolate bits over butterscotch bits. Dribble condensed milk over mixture. Do not stir. Sprinkle nuts over the top. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. Cut in squares. Yields 2 dozen.

name: INSTANT COOKIES
steps: Mix ingredients. Add chips. Drop by teaspoon on cookie sheet. Bake at 350° about 10 to 12 minutes. Butter or yellow cake mixes are good with chocolate chips. Applesauce or spice cake mixes are good with raisins. Very quick and easy.

name: KEE FLEE COOKIES
steps: Cream together cream cheese and oleo, then add and mix together 4 cups flour. Divide dough into 4 balls and refrigerate overnight (cover). Take out 1 ball at a time. Pinch off dough the size of a walnut and roll out on a powdered sugared board, about 3 inches around. Put a teaspoon of filling at one end and roll up. Pinch ends closed. Put on ungreased baking sheet at 350° for approximately 15 minutes. (As soon as they start turning very light brown, remove.) Take off cookie sheet immediately and cool on the rack. Store in a covered container.
Filling-- , 1 stick oleo (aka margarine), 5 c. ground walnuts, 1 c. granulated sugar, 2 well beaten eggs
Mix well. Store leftover filling in covered dish.
by: Sheryl Ann Monroe, Ruth Graham Cross

name: MOLASSES COOKIES
steps: Cream together shortening and sugar. Add egg. Then add molasses. Sift together dry ingredients. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture, then add raisins. Chill. Drop by teaspoons onto cookie sheet or form small balls of dough by hand. Bake 10 minutes in 375° oven. Delicious.
by: Anne Graham Allen, Daughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: NURSES COOKIES

ingredients.name: can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk

steps: Mix thoroughly; dump into pan. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Cool. Cut into squares and serve.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: NEAPOLITAN COOKIES
steps: Grease and flour 3 (13 x9-inch) pans. Line with wax paper and grease again. Beat up almond paste, then beat with butter. Add sugar and egg yolks. Beat until fluffy. Add flour and beat until well mixed. Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold into batter until mixed through. Separate into three equal amounts. Color one red (about 20 drops), one green (about 12 drops) and one yellow (about 10 drops). Spread evenly into 3 (13 x 9-inch) pans. Bake at 350° about 9 minutes. Put raspberry jam on one layer; top with another layer. Spread on apricot jam; put top layer on and press with heavy board or books overnight. Next day, melt 6 ounces chocolate chips and spread over top. Slice 4 cuts lengthwise and 20 to 24 across. Makes at least 80 cookies.

name: OATMEAL COOKIES
steps: Mix all together. Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes.
by: Susan Graham Neff, Daughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: OUT-OF-THIS-WORLD COOKIES

ingredients.name: 12 oz. bag chocolate chips or dipping chocolate, melted

steps: Cream sugar and peanut butter. Add dates, nuts and cornflakes. Mix well. Shape into balls. Let mixture sit overnight. Dip into chocolate and chill until mixture hardens.
by: Ginger Graham, Daughter of James I. and Ella Graham, Granddaughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Great Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES
steps: Mix ingredients together. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350° until done.

name: SHIRLEY'S MONSTER COOKIES
steps: Mix eggs, margarine and sugars together. Add peanut butter, soda, vanilla and oats. Mix well. Add M&M's, chocolate chips and nuts. Use ice cream scoop size. Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes. Can be frozen in scoop size and baked as needed.

name: SNICKERDOODLES
steps: Mix together shortening, 1 1/2 cups sugar and eggs. Sift together flour, cream of tartar, soda and salt. Mix all together. Chill dough. Roll into balls, walnut size. Roll each ball into a mixture of 2 tablespoons sugar and 2 tablespoons cinnamon. Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.
by: Susan Graham Neff, Daughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SOUR CREAM SOFTIES
steps: Cream butter with sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Measure flour, salt, baking powder and soda into sifter. Add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream. Blend well to make a thick batter. Drop by rounded tablespoons four inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Spread into 2-inch rounds. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 400° until lightly browned around edges. Cool completely on wire rack.

name: TEXAS LIZZIES
steps: Cream butter and sugar. Add well beaten eggs. Then add whiskey slowly. Add flour, soda, fruit, nuts, nutmeg and cinnamon. Work well with hands. Chill overnight in refrigerator. Bake in 350° oven, after you have spoon dropped on cookie sheet, 2 inches apart. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes.
Chilled dough can be kept in refrigerator for months.

name: MINT BROWNIES
subtitle: (Layered)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°. Grease 15 1/2 × 10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan. Melt chocolate in heavy pan over low heat; stir until smooth. In large bowl, mix sugar, corn syrup, vanilla and butter. Beat until light and fluffy. Add flour, salt and eggs. Beat well at low speed. Beat in chocolate with spoon; stir in walnuts. Spread in pan. Bake 40 to 45 minutes. Cool in pan. When brownies are cool, prepare mint frosting.
Mint Frosting-- , 2 c. confectioner's sugar, 6 Tbsp. margarine, 1/2 tsp. peppermint extract, green food color

In a large bowl with mixer on low, beat sugar, margarine and extract until smooth. Add green food color just to tint a pretty green. Spread evenly over brownies. Refrigerate while preparing Chocolate Glaze.
Chocolate Glaze-- , 3 sq. unsweetened chocolate, 1 sq. semi-sweet chocolate, 4 Tbsp. margarine, 2 tsp. dark corn syrup

In heavy 2 quart saucepan, over low heat, heat chocolate, margarine and syrup until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Remove and stir until mixture cools slightly. Spread over mint brownies. Refrigerate until glaze is set. Cut in small bars.

name: SAUCEPAN BROWNIES
steps: Melt margarine and chocolate in a kettle. Remove from heat. Add all ingredients except eggs. Mix to blend. Add eggs and beat well. Pour into two 15 x 10-inch pans, rubbed with margarine. Bake in a moderate oven at 350° about 30 minutes. Do not overbake. Cool in pan. Cut into bars at serving time.

name: BEST-EVER LEMON PIE
steps: Mix sugar and cornstarch together in top of double boiler. Add the 2 cups of water. Combine egg yolks with juice and beat. Add to rest of mixture. Cook until thick over boiling water for 25 minutes. This does away with starchy taste. Add lemon extract, butter and vinegar and stir thoroughly. Pour into a deep, 9-inch pie shell and let cool. Cover with meringue and brown in oven.

name: NEVER-FAIL MERINGUE
steps: Blend cornstarch and cold water in a saucepan. Add boiling water and cook, stirring, until clear and thickened. Let stand until completely cold.
