With electric beater at high speed, beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff, but not dry. Turn mixer to low speed; add salt and vanilla. Gradually beat in cold cornstarch mixture. Turn mixer again to high speed and beat well. Spread meringue over cooled pie filling. Bake at 350° for about 10 minutes. This meringue cuts beautifully and never gets sticky.

name: KENTUCKY DERBY PIE
steps: Mix above together. Put in pie crust. Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.

name: MOTHER'S CREAM PIE
steps: Mix first 4 ingredients, cooking on medium heat until boiling. Remove from heat and add pinch of salt, vanilla and butter. Cool, pour into baked pie shell and top with meringue.
Meringue-- , 2 egg whites (from above), pinch of salt, 3 Tbsp. sugar
Beat egg whites until very stiff. Add salt and sugar. Beat well and place on pie. Brown lightly under low broiler. Watch carefully.
Josie gave this recipe to all her family and they make it beautifully.

name: PUMPKIN PIE
steps: Preheat oven to 425°. Mix well and pour into 1 (9-inch) pie shell. Bake at 425° for 15 minutes. Lower oven to 350° and bake for 45 minutes. When knife comes out clean, pie is done. Let cool and serve with whipped cream. Makes 1 (9-inch) pie.

name: PIE CRUST
steps: Mix flour, salt and shortening until fine crumbs. Add water, mix and roll out to fit pan. Makes 1 (9-inch) pie shell.

name: SOUR CREAM APPLE PIE
steps: Combine sour cream, sugar, flour, salt, flavorings and egg. Beat well. Add apples. Pour into pie shell. Bake in 400° oven for 25 minutes.
Topping-- , 1/3 c. sugar, 1/3 c. flour, 1/4 c. butter, 1 tsp. cinnamon
Combine all together; sprinkle over pie. Bake 20 minutes at 350°.

name: GINGERBREAD
steps: Cream sugar, shortening, eggs and molasses. Mix dry ingredients together. Mix well and add boiling water. Pour into greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 325° for about 45 minutes or until done.

name: GRAHAM GEMS
steps: Mix dry ingredients. Add milk, egg, melted shortening and molasses (or sugar). Mix well. Spoon into muffin tins half full. Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.

name: LUCY'S MUFFINS

ingredients.name: enough flour to make stiff dough

steps: Soak raisins in hot water. Let cool in lukewarm water. Mix all ingredients as for any other muffin. Makes 3 dozen. Bake in 350° oven until done. Test with toothpick. This is a very old recipe.

name: PUMPKIN BREAD
steps: In a bowl, combine all dry ingredients. Set aside. Cream oil and sugar. Add eggs, pumpkin and water. Slowly add dry ingredients. Mix until smooth with mixer. Add raisins. Pour into 9 1/4 x 5 1/4-inch loaf pans. Bake at 350° for 60 to 65 minutes. Makes two loaves.
by: Edna Graham Halsey, Daughter of Fonzie and Nell Graham, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PUMPKIN BREAD
steps: Sift flour, soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and puddings together in large bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Beat well together, then add 1 cup chopped nuts. Mix well. Pour into 3 greased and floured loaf pans. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

name: ZUCCHINI BREAD
steps: Beat eggs, oil and vanilla until foamy; add to dry ingredients; mix well, but not too long. Pour in well greased 4 x 6-inch loaf pans. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until done.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BREAD PUDDING
steps: Mix milk and margarine together. Combine all ingredients in baking dish. Bake at 350° with pan of water beneath for 45 minutes or until knife comes out clean. Serve warm with lemon or chocolate sauce. I just like it hot.

name: BREAD PUDDING
steps: Soak bread in milk; add beaten eggs, sugar and salt. Pour into a greased pudding dish. Sprinkle with nutmeg sparingly. Place the pudding dish in a pan of hot water. Bake in 350° oven for 30 minutes or until firm and brown on top.

name: DESSERT DELIGHT

ingredients.name: 4 oz. can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
10 oz. pkg. frozen sliced sweetened strawberries

steps: In small saucepan, melt butter. Stir in crumbs. Pat firmly on bottom of 11 × 7-inch baking dish and chill. In large bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in sweetened condensed milk and undrained strawberries. Fold in marshmallows and whipped cream. Pour over vanilla wafer crust. Chill 2 hours and garnish with whipped topping and strawberries.

name: FRIED DRIED APPLE PIES
steps: Cook about 1/2 gallon (measurement after cooking) of dried apples and cook nearly all of water out. Mash fine and add sugar and cinnamon. Buy a good brand of biscuits. Roll out thin, moisten edges with water, put a spoon of apples in center, fold over and crimp with fork. Fry in hot vegetable oil at medium-high temperature so as to get biscuit done on inside before browning too fast on outside.

name: FRIED ICE CREAM
steps: Scoop ice cream and roll in cinnamon and sugar, then in crushed cornflakes. Freeze on trays. When needed, deep fry about 30 seconds. Serve with hot chocolate topping or caramel topping, whipped cream and cherry.

name: ICE CREAM ROLL
steps: Preheat oven to 350°. Grease and line with wax paper 2 jelly roll pans. Beat eggs until fluffy, add cake mix and all ingredients per directions. Split cake mix between 2 pans. Bake about 15 minutes, testing for doneness. Turn out cake on towel sprinkled with powdered sugar. Peel off waxed paper and roll in towel. Let cool. Put ice cream in refrigerator to thaw. When cake is cooled, unroll. Spread with 1 quart of ice cream, reroll and freeze. When ready to serve, slice and add favorite topping, whipped cream and cherry. A great do ahead dessert. Makes 2 rolls; each serves 10.

name: LAYER DESSERT
steps: First Layer__ Cream together 1 stick butter with 1 cup flour and 1/2 cup nuts. Pat down in 9 x 13-inch pan to make crust and bake 12 minutes at 350° and let cool.
Second Layer__ Mix one 8 ounce package cream cheese, 1 cup powdered sugar and 1 cup Cool Whip lightly and spread over first cooled layer and sprinkle with 1/4 cup coconut.
Third Layer__ Mix 2 boxes instant pudding with 3 cups cold milk. Beat as directed on package and spread over second layer.
Fourth Layer__ Spread remainder of Cool Whip over third layer. Sprinkle with coconut and pecans. Will keep several days in refrigerator.

name: NEVER FAIL EGG CUSTARD
steps: Blend eggs, sugar, salt, vanilla and almond. Gradually stir in scalded milk. Use electric mixer on blend. Pour into 9-inch pie shell. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean. Sprinkle top with nutmeg. Cool at room temperature. Put a ring of foil around outside of pie to prevent crust from getting too brown.

name: RIBBON JELLO

ingredients.name: pkg. Jell-O (lime, orange, lemon and cherry)

steps: Dissolve lime Jell-O in 1 cup boiling water. Add 1/2 cup cold water. Place in 9 × 13-inch pan. Bring 2 cups of milk to a boil: Add 2 cups sugar and stir. Dissolve 2 packages gelatine in 1/2 cup cold water. Add gelatine mixture to milk and sugar mixture.

Mix 2 teaspoons vanilla in 1 pint sour cream and sugar. Add to milk and gelatine mixture. Beat with mixer. When cold, put 1/3 of mixture over lime Jell-O (very gently). Lime Jell-O must be set. Put back in refrigerator. When set, add cold lemon (do not pour), spread with spoon; set. Then add 1/3 white, then orange; set. Then add white, then red. Set and serve.

name: SHIRLEY'S PUMPKIN ROLL
steps: Preheat oven to 350°. Line jelly roll pan with wax paper. Pour pumpkin batter onto pan and spread. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn out roll onto a clean towel. Peel off wax paper and roll short ends up. Cool in towel.
Filling Part-- , 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, 2 Tbsp. soft margarine, 1 tsp. vanilla, 1 c. sifted powdered sugar

Cream all ingredients together. After pumpkin has cooled, unroll and spread filling mixture. Reroll without towel. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and roll into plastic freezer wrap. Refrigerate until ready to serve. These freeze very well. One 16 ounce can of pumpkin makes 3 rolls. Enough to eat and enough to freeze.

name: GRAPE JUICE
subtitle: (1 Quart)
steps: Fill with boiling water. Seal and process in boiling bath. Let water come to a full rolling boil 10 minutes.

name: NANCY'S FRIENDSHIP SPICED TEA

ingredients.name: small pkg. lemonade or 1 c. Country Time

steps: Mix and store in airtight container. Use 2 teaspoons per cup with boiling water.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PINA COLADA

ingredients.name: 15 oz. can or bottle cream of coconut
fifth light rum (Bacardi) or flavoring to taste

steps: Blend pineapple, coconut and bananas until creamy in blender. Boil water; add sugar, mix and cool. Add to blended mixture. Add 7-Up and rum to mixture. Freeze. Before serving, blend in blender until slushy. Makes 2 gallons.
by: Debbie Cross Booker, Daughter of Ruth and Henry Cross, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: PUNCH

ingredients.name: cans lemon juice or juice of 6 lemons

steps: Mix all together. Makes 3 gallons.

name: PUNCH FOR A BUNCH
subtitle: (75 Servings)

ingredients.name: small cans frozen lemon juice or juice of 3 fresh lemons

steps: Dissolve gelatins in water; cool. Add juices and sugar. Chill and serve.

name: RUSSIAN TEA
steps: Bring to a boil cinnamon sticks, cloves, sugar, water and tea bags. Let simmer 10 minutes, let set 5 minutes and strain. Add juices and lemonade. Mix together, add 3 more quarts of water and store in refrigerator. This can be served hot or cold. Makes 1 gallon.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SLUSH PUNCH
steps: Blend bananas and fruit juices in blender until smooth. Mix sugar and water together. Add all ingredients except 7-Up together. Freeze in two or more containers overnight or until one hour before serving. Set out of freezer for one hour. Chop into chunks. Pour 7-Up over and serve. Great for a hot day.
by: Rebecca K. Neuhard, Daughter of Ruth and Henry Cross, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SUN TEA
steps: Put in clear jar and set in the sun until the color is right.

name: WASSAIL BOWL PUNCH
steps: Combine all ingredients, except orange and lemon slices. Bring to a boil. Pour into a bowl and float orange and lemon slices. I serve from crock-pot so it stays hot.
by: Josie Elkins Hollon, Daughter of Ruby and George D. Elkins, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: BASIC MINTS
steps: *Lemon flavor and yellow color, mint flavor and pink color or wintergreen and green color.

Knead cream cheese and sugar together with hands. Mix colorings and flavoring in well. Shape as desired. You can roll these in sugar and mold in candy molds or dip in melted chocolate, using them as centers.

name: CHOCOLATE FUDGE
steps: Boil sugar and milk 6 minutes. Mix together butter, chocolate chips, marshmallow cream and nuts. Pour hot sugar and milk mixture over, stirring until all is melted and blended. Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan. Cool and cut into squares.

name: COTTAGE BRITTLE
steps: Butter sides of saucepan for candy making to prevent mixture from climbing sides of pan and boiling over.

Place all of the nuts in an 8 × 8 × 2-inch baking pan. Toast nuts in a 325° oven 15 minutes. Stir twice. Butter saucepan (3 quart). In saucepan, add sugar, corn syrup and butter. Cook over medium heat to boiling, stirring constantly with wooden spoon. Clip candy thermometer to side of pan. Cook over medium heat without stirring until mixture reaches 290°. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla. Stir in nuts. Turn onto cookie sheet. Cool, break into pieces and store in airtight container. Makes 2 1/4 pounds.

name: CREAM CANDY
steps: Use a large deep pot on a dry day. Boil, unstirred, until hard ball stage. Pour into buttered platters until just cool enough to handle. Butter hands and pull until white (careful not to let cream in hands). Lay it down and cut into pieces.

name: CANDY STRAWBERRIES
steps: Mix pecans, coconut, Jell-O, milk and vanilla. Shape into strawberries. Roll strawberries in red sugar crystals. Insert slice of almond for leaves and chill.

name: HARD CANDY
steps: Boil together to 300°. Then add 1/2 teaspoon flavoring and coloring. Stir to mix. Pour out on a buttered marble slab and work with spatula until cool enough to handle. Using kitchen shears, cut in small pillow shapes. Work fast, as the candy hardens fast. When cool, roll in powdered sugar.
Oil flavorings are found in most drug stores. Our favorites are cinnamon, clove, spearmint, peppermint and lemon.

name: LINDA'S CARAMELS
steps: Mix all ingredients in large saucepan. Cook until hard ball stage (must stir constantly). Add vanilla. Pour into buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Let cool completely; cut into squares. Wrap in wax paper or plastic wrap. Makes great caramel for homemade turtles.
by: Rebecca K. Neuhard, Daughter of Ruth and Henry Cross, Granddaughter of George and Josie Graham

name: OLD FASHIONED PULL TAFFY
steps: In a heavy saucepan, cook sugar until it dissolves. Add remaining ingredients and cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture reaches hard-ball stage. Pour into a buttered pan and let cool. When still warm, rub butter on your hands and pull the candy back and forth until it has a satiny finish. Cut with scissors into desired size pieces and wrap in wax paper lo store.

name: PEANUT BUTTER FUDGE
steps: Work together and press into pan.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: SULTANA FUDGE
steps: Melt and boil butter, corn syrup, sugar, milk and cocoa to soft ball stage. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until creamy. Cut. You may substitute peanut butter for cocoa. This recipe never fails.

name: BELL'S HOMEMADE BUTTERMILK
steps: Put in 1 gallon jug and fill with water. Stir well.
by: Nora Graham Hollon, Daughter of George and Josie Graham

name: CANNED PIE FILLING
steps: Mix and heat sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and water. Add 3 teaspoons lemon juice. Fill quart jars 1/3 full of liquid. Add sliced apples to fill jars. Process 20 minutes in boiling bath. (One canner - 7 quarts)
When opening a jar to use, add 2 tablespoons cornstarch.

name: CELERY SEED SALAD DRESSING
steps: Blend in blender.

name: COUGH SYRUP
steps: Heat on very low temperature until candy is dissolved.

name: CROUTONS
steps: Sauté in pan until coated. Put in 400° oven until brown. Watch closely.

name: DRIED APPLE STORAGE HINT
steps: Put dried apples in clean, dry canning jar. Put on new canning lids that have been heated in boiling water. Place jars in 165° oven for 45 minutes. Turn off oven, leaving the jars in the oven until completely cooled, or overnight. This can be done in half gallon jars, by laying them on their side on oven rack.

name: HOMEMADE CHOW MEIN NOODLES
steps: Cook spaghetti until barely tender. Drain on wax paper and sprinkle with cornstarch. Take about 8 to 12 pieces of spaghetti and roll around on the cornstarch. In large pot or deep fryer, heat oil, pick up the spaghetti all at once and slowly lower it into the hot oil. It will form a kind of patty. When light brown, remove and drain on paper towel. Sprinkle with salt. Do the rest of the spaghetti in same manner. This is a good snack or use it the same as you would canned chow mein noodles.

name: HOMEMADE SOAP
steps: To mix, follow directions on the can of lye. Place in glass or enamel pan. Let set. Cut in squares. (Talk about getting your clothes clean)

name: MEXICAN TACO SEASON MIX
steps: Mix together. Store in airtight container. Two tablespoons equals 1 commercial package.

name: MICROWAVE CARAMEL CORN
steps: Combine all ingredients except soda and popcorn in 2 quart dish. Bring to a boil, then cook on Full power 2 minutes. Remove from microwave and stir in soda. Place popped corn in brown paper grocery bag. Pour syrup over corn. Close bag and shake well. Cook in bag on High in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes. Shake well and cook another 1 1/2 minutes. Shake well. Pour into ungreased pan, stir while cooling. Store in airtight container, if it lasts that long!

name: MOCK STRAWBERRY PRESERVES
steps: Place rhubarb and sugar in saucepan and boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add two (3 ounce) boxes of strawberry Jell-O. Mix thoroughly and put in jars. Makes 3 pints. Keep refrigerated.

name: RICE
steps: Sauté onion in butter until transparent. Combine onion, rice and hot chicken broth. Bring to a boil, cover and place in 325° oven for 20 minutes. Do not uncover or look at rice. Leave in oven 20 minutes. Remove and fluff. This will turn out perfect every time.

name: SANDWICH SPREAD
steps: Grind tomatoes and peppers. Pour enough boiling water over them to cover. Strain and cook 10 minutes with everything except Miracle Whip. Add Miracle Whip and just get hot. Fill hot jars and seal. Good alone, on bread or with meat sandwich.
